name: Bibliotheca Alexandrina
Keywords: modern library, amazing library, cultural center, guided tour, alexandria library, beautiful building, amazing place, books, manuscripts, libraries, exhibition, architecture, sadat, collection, exhibits, millions, permanent, knowledge, egypt, archives, project, arabic, security, egp, mediterranean, corniche
Description: Located near the site of the ancient library of Alexandria, this modern version is an eleven-story, cylindrical-shaped building that houses more than eight million books. A re-imagining of Alexandria's ancient Great Library, this gorgeously designed cultural center contains a host of museums as well as one of the modern world's most ambitious libraries. Its architecture - a giant sun disk - presides over the waterfront Corniche, while inside, a huge reading room can hold eight million volumes. Below themain library, visitors can explore a range of beautifully curated exhibitions. TheManuscript Museum with its magnificent collection of ancient texts and scrolls and the Antiquities Museum with its Graeco-Roman antiquities and statuary found during underwater exploration in the harbor are the two prime attractions. But there are also rotating art exhibitions, a permanent Egyptian folk art collection, and a Science Museum and Planetarium that are aimed squarely at children.

name: Imhotep Museum
Keywords: exhibits, scribe, architect
Description: The Imhotep Museum, located at the foot of the Step Pyramid of Djoser in Saqqara, Egypt, is a captivating tribute to one of ancient Egypt's most revered figures, Imhotep. As the architect of the world's first monumental stone building, the Step Pyramid complex, Imhotep is celebrated as a visionary genius whose innovations revolutionized ancient Egyptian architecture and engineering.

name: Port Said Military Museum
Keywords: Military

Situated in a strategic location overlooking the canal, the museum serves as a testament to the region's pivotal role in Egypt's military endeavors throughout history.

name: El Nasr Museum For Modern Art
Keywords: modern, history
Description: The El Nasr Museum for Modern Art, located in Cairo, Egypt, is a prestigious institution dedicated to showcasing the vibrant and diverse expressions of modern and contemporary Egyptian art. Founded in 1962, the museum is housed within the historic Cairo Opera House complex, providing a culturally rich environment for visitors to explore and appreciate the nation's artistic heritage.

name: The Fine Arts Museum
Keywords: art
Description: The Fine Arts Museum in Alexandria, Egypt, is a cultural treasure trove nestled within the vibrant cityscape of Egypt's Mediterranean coast. Established in 1959, the museum is housed in the former palace of Princess Fatma Al-Zahraa, situated in the historic district of Zizinia.

name: Ahmed Shawki Museum
Keywords: art, history, write, popular
Description: This museum is in recognition of the great Poet-Laureate Ahmed Shawki, which houses a wide collection of more than 713 manuscripts and drafts, a collection of oil paintings, antique objects and photographs of the poet and his family.

name: The Grand Egyptian Museum
Keywords: ancient egypt, pharaohs, pyramids, archaeology, tutankhamun, artifacts, exhibits, antiquities, cultural heritage
Description: is an upcoming museum in Giza, Egypt. It is scheduled to be one of the largest archaeological museums in the world, dedicated to showcasing the treasures of ancient Egypt. The museum will house a vast collection of artifacts, including those belonging to King Tutankhamun and other pharaohs, offering visitors a comprehensive insight into Egypt's rich cultural heritage.

name: Abdeen Palace Museum
Keywords: silverware collection, arms, Wepon, Royal family, Historical Documents, Royal family history
Description: Abdeen Palace Museum in Cairo, Egypt, is a 19th-century palace turned museum. It features a captivating blend of Ottoman, Renaissance, and Rococo architectural styles. Within its walls, you’ll find the Silver Museum (with exquisite silverware), the Arms Museum (displaying ancient weapons), the Royal Family Museum (immersed in Egyptian royal history), the Presidential Gifts Museum, and the Historical Documents Museum. Each section offers a unique glimpse into Egypt’s past.

name: Tanta Museum
Keywords: pharaonic artifacts, greco-roman period, Islmaic era, coptic heritage, statues, manuscripts, textiles, deities statues
Description: The Tanta Museum, is a captivating repository of Egypt's rich historical tapestry. Opened to the public in 1990, the museum houses an extensive collection of artifacts spanning several eras of Egyptian history, including the Pharaonic, Greco-Roman, Coptic, and Islamic periods. Visitors can explore exhibits featuring ancient statues, pottery, tools, and everyday items that provide insights into the lives and cultures of ancient Egyptians. The museum also boasts Greco-Roman artifacts that reflect the cultural fusion during those periods, as well as Islamic manuscripts, ceramics, and metalwork that highlight the artistic and scholarly achievements of the Islamic era. Coptic artifacts, such as icons and textiles, offer a glimpse into the Christian heritage of Egypt. By preserving and showcasing these diverse artifacts, the Tanta Museum serves as a vital cultural institution, helping visitors to appreciate and understand the profound historical legacy of the region.

As a testament to meticulous preservation efforts, the museum invites visitors to explore Fayoum's rich heritage in a compact yet immersive experience.

name: Egyptian Textiles Museum
Keywords: Egyptian textiles during the Dynastic Era (3100 BCE–300 BCE) were primarily linen, although wool was not unknown. (Cotton and silk were introduced only later.) Linen was produced in three basic grades: royal or fine linen, thin cloth, and smooth cloth.
Description: is a unique building designed to host the world's oldest collection of Pharaonic art and monuments. Built on an area of 13,600 sq.

name: The Royal Mummies Hall
Keywords: Considered the crown jewel of the museum, the Royal Mummies' Hall is specially designed to display the mummies of the ancient Kings and Queens of Egypt.
Description: Royal Mummies' Hall is specially designed to display the mummies of the ancient Kings and Queens of Egypt. The design aims to give the visitor the feeling of strolling down the Valley of The Kings, where most of these mummies were originally resting.

name: The Child Museum
Keywords: The Children’s Museum was inaugurated during a special ceremony in 2010 by His Royal Highness Prince Henrik of Denmark, the former Head of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, Dr. Zahi Hawass, and the former Director of the Egyptian Museum, Dr. Wafaa Al Saddik.
Description: The Children’s Museum is proud to feature a special display made of LEGO imported specially from Denmark. Along with the exciting LEGO models, we also exhibit replicas and educational models produced by the Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities’ Production Unit.

name: Mummification Museum
Keywords: Mummification museum in Luxor (ancient Thebes), intended to provide an understanding of the process to preserve the body. The ancient Egyptians not only applied embalming to dead humans but also to many animals (Cats, dogs, crocodiles…. etc.). God Anubis(the Jackal) was the god of embalming and mummification.
Description: The methods of embalming, or treating the dead body, that the ancient Egyptians used is called mummification. Using special processes, the Egyptians removed all moisture from the body, leaving only a dried form that would not easily decay.

name: Greco-Roman Museum
Keywords: The museum contains several pieces dating from the Greco-Roman (Ptolemaic) era in the 3rd century BC, such as a sculpture of Apis in black granite, the sacred bull of the Egyptians, mummies, sarcophagus, tapestries, and other objects offering a view of Greco-Roman civilization in contact with ancient Egypt.
Description: The museum's collection is the product of donations from wealthy Alexandrians as well as of excavations led by successive directors of the institution, both within the town and in its environs. Certain other objects have come from the Organization of Antiquities at Cairo

name: Museum of Modern Egyptian Art

Description: The Agricultural Museum Egypt features a variety of displays about farming practices from ancient times to the present day. Agriculture has played a major role in the Egyptian history and always affected the lives of Egyptians from the days of the pharaohs up to our modern time..
